data.title: The Calm + Talking Heads
data.meta_description: The Calm Before the Storm is a television film by Kieślowski about a builder who becomes embroiled in a fateful labour conflict. Preceded by his short Talking Heads, in which he asks forty people questions such as: "Who are you?" and "What do you most wish for?"
data.text:
In this short film, Kieślowski asks the questions "In which year were you born?" "Who are you?" and "What do you most wish for?" to forty different people, ranging from a baby to a one-hundred-year-old woman.

A young man in his twenties leaves prison having served three years for a crime he didn’t commit. He wants to start over in a new place and dreams of a job, a wife and a family. He gets part way to making this dream reality, when while working a labouring job he winds up in a fateful conflict between the corrupt boss and colleagues who are secretly planning a strike. He ends up being a pawn for one side, while trying to stick to his ideals with the other.

For a long time, Polish censors tried to prohibit screenings of this TV film, probably because of the grim portrait it paints of a society that only brings happiness to the happy few.
